definition:
Let $M$ be a left (or right) $R$-module. The *socle* of $M$, denoted by
$\operatorname{Soc}(M)$, is the sum of all simple (or minimal)
submodules of $M$. If $M$ has no simple submodules, then
$\operatorname{Soc}(M):=(0)$.

A left (or right) $R$-module $M$ is semisimple iff
$\operatorname{Soc}(M)=M$.
